title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 219-4.3 - Particulate emissions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 219-4.3 - Particulate emissions

State Regulations
(a) No person
may cause or allow emissions of particulates into the outdoor atmosphere from
an existing cremation unit in excess of 0.08 grains per dry standard cubic foot
of flue gas, corrected to seven percent oxygen. (b) No person may cause or allow emissions of
particulates into the outdoor atmosphere from a new or modified cremation unit
in excess of 0.05 grains per dry standard cubic foot of flue gas, corrected to
seven percent oxygen. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
219-4.3

Amended

New

York State Register March 4, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 9, eff. 3/14/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
